cookingMethod: Preheat the oven to 375°F. Cook the lasagna noodles according to the package instructions. Brown the ground beef in a large skillet. Add the tomato sauce and simmer for 10 minutes. In a bowl, mix together the ricotta and mozzarella cheeses. In a 9x13-inch baking dish, layer the noodles, meat sauce, and cheese mixture. Repeat until all ingredients are used up, ending with a layer of cheese on top. Bake for 30-35 minutes, or until bubbly and golden brown.

Cook the spaghetti according to the package instructions. In a bowl, mix together the ground beef, breadcrumbs, egg, onion, garlic, salt, and pepper. Form the mixture into meatballs and brown them in a large skillet. Add the tomato sauce and simmer for 10-15 minutes. Serve the meatballs and sauce over the spaghetti and sprinkle with Parmesan cheese.

Preheat the oven to 450°F. Roll out the pizza dough and spread the tomato sauce over it. Top with mozzarella cheese and fresh basil. Bake for 10-12 minutes, or until the crust is golden brown and the cheese is melted and bubbly.

Brew the espresso and mix in the Marsala wine. In a bowl, beat together the mascarpone cheese, heavy cream, and sugar until smooth. Dip the ladyfingers in the espresso mixture and layer them in a dish. Spread the mascarpone mixture over the ladyfingers. Repeat until all ingredients are used up, ending with a layer of mascarpone on top. Chill for at least 2 hours. Dust with cocoa powder before serving.
